intro: Psychotria cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
